page.title: 04SHOPPING IN STRATTON
page.content: Our area lacks shopping facilities. There are only{33 shops}in the 12 sq km area catering for a population of{23 000.}There is no shopping centre, simply 3 small blocks of shops at{Beechcroft Road, Grange Drive and {lower Ermin St.}There are larger shopping centres nearby at{Gorse Hill and{Stratton Crossroads,}but even so regular trips have to be made across town to the central shopping centre or even to the West Swindon centre. The lack of adequate shops has been a source of complaint in our area for many years; envious eyes have been cast in the direction of West Swindon as increasingly comprehensive facilities have been built there. At last, in March 1985, planning approval was given for the construction of a {superstore}beside the A4311 road opposite the Crest Motel.
